snippet.title: 'Capt. America' tops box office for third week
snippet.description: Captain America continues to vanquish box office foes, triumphing in ticket sales for the third consecutive week and dominating over megastar Johnny Depp's new movie.

snippet.title: Wonkbook: The early benefits of embracing Obamacare
snippet.description: States that embrace Obamacare are doing much better at insuring people than non-embracing states are.

snippet.title: A fearful new world, imperiled by Russia's subterfuge
snippet.description: Russia's subterfuge must be countered by new U.S. military strategies.

snippet.title: Gay rights in Nigeria: An interview with Bisi Alimi
snippet.description: "It's like a fairy tale, a badly written Disney fairy tale, this Nigeria rising thing."

snippet.title: 'Captain America,' 'Rio 2' top box office
snippet.description: In a springtime battle of sequels, "Captain America: The Winter Soldier" stayed strong enough to narrowly triumph over the debut of "Rio 2."

snippet.title: PBS's 'The Address': Where 'four score and seven years ago' is a rite of passage
With $41.4M, 'Captain America' holds off 'Rio 2'
snippet.description: "Captain America" continued to flex its Marvel muscle at the global box office, as "The Winter Soldier" took in $41.4 million domestically and $60.6 million overseas.

snippet.title: Who else was worthy of 'Late Show' prize?
snippet.description: Congratulations, Stephen Colbert, on winning CBS' "Late Show" gig. You're brilliantly funny, you've proven yourself in the Comedy Central farm leagues, and odds are you will be a worthy successor to David Letterman.

snippet.title: Crisis deepens at Co-op Group as director quits
snippet.description: The man brought in four months ago to help fix Britain's Co-operative Group is resigning, the company said Thursday, deepening the crisis at one of the country's most venerable businesses.
